@graph.caption: A sliced loaf of cherry amaretto bread on a wooden chopping block

@graph.name: Cherry Amaretto Bread Loaf. Vegan. - Vegan Richa
@graph.description: This cherry amaretto bread loaf is yeast based and made with melted ice cream! A vegan bread recipe that is perfect for any occasion

@graph.name: Cherry Amaretto Bread Loaf
@graph.description: This cherry amaretto bread loaf is yeast based and made with melted ice cream! Make 8 by 4 inch loaf
recipeIngredient: 1 cup melted So Delicious Cherry Amaretto Almond milk icecream
2 Tablespoons organic canola oil  (or olive oil)

recipeInstructions.text: Add the yeast and 1 teaspoon sugar to warm water. Mix and let it sit until frothy. 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the yeast and 1 teaspoon sugar to warm water. Mix and let it sit until frothy. 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: In a stand mixer, add the flours, salt, rest of the sugar and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: In a stand mixer, add the flours, salt, rest of the sugar and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the melted icecream, oil and yeast mixture and knead for 6-8 minutes. Scraping sides every 2-3 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the melted icecream, oil and yeast mixture and knead for 6-8 minutes. Scraping sides every 2-3 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Check the dough when it starts to form and Add a Tablespoon or so more warm water if the dough is hard to touch. Also add in half a cup of chopped cherries if you like.
recipeInstructions.name: Check the dough when it starts to form and Add a Tablespoon or so more warm water if the dough is hard to touch. Also add in half a cup of chopped cherries if you like.

recipeInstructions.text: Knead into a soft dough. The dough should be soft and well formed. It will be sticky because of the icecream, but not because of excess wetness.
recipeInstructions.name: Knead into a soft dough. The dough should be soft and well formed. It will be sticky because of the icecream, but not because of excess wetness.

recipeInstructions.text: Place dough in well greased container. Spray water on top, cover and let sit in a warm place for 1.5 hours or until doubled.
recipeInstructions.name: Place dough in well greased container. Spray water on top, cover and let sit in a warm place for 1.5 hours or until doubled.

recipeInstructions.text: Take dough out on a working surface.
recipeInstructions.name: Take dough out on a working surface.

recipeInstructions.text: Using a little bread flour, knead for a minute, and then flatten it out into an inch thick rectangle.
recipeInstructions.name: Using a little bread flour, knead for a minute, and then flatten it out into an inch thick rectangle.

recipeInstructions.text: Roll it up like a jelly roll. Seal the edges. Place the roll seam side down in a well greased or parchment lined bread pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Roll it up like a jelly roll. Seal the edges. Place the roll seam side down in a well greased or parchment lined bread pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Spray water on top. Sprinkle some oats or seeds.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray water on top. Sprinkle some oats or seeds.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover with a towel and let rise in a warm place for 45 minutes or until doubled.
recipeInstructions.name: Cover with a towel and let rise in a warm place for 45 minutes or until doubled.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake in pre-heated 365 degrees F for 35-40 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake in pre-heated 365 degrees F for 35-40 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from bread pan and cool on rack completely before slicing.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from bread pan and cool on rack completely before slicing.
